Gets a glossary. Returns NOT_FOUND, if the glossary doesn't exist.

<h4 id="glossaryinputconfigresponse">Glossary<wbr>Input<wbr>Config<wbr>Response</h4>



{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="gcssource_csharp">
<a href="#gcssource_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Gcs<wbr>Source</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#gcssourceresponse">Pulumi.<wbr>Google<wbr>Native.<wbr>Translate.<wbr>V3Beta1.<wbr>Inputs.<wbr>Gcs<wbr>Source<wbr>Response</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Required. Google Cloud Storage location of glossary data. File format is determined based on the filename extension. API returns [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT] for unsupported URI-s and file formats. Wildcards are not allowed. This must be a single file in one of the following formats: For unidirectional glossaries: - TSV/CSV (`.tsv`/`.csv`): 2 column file, tab- or comma-separated. The first column is source text. The second column is target text. The file must not contain headers. That is, the first row is data, not column names. - TMX (`.tmx`): TMX file with parallel data defining source/target term pairs. For equivalent term sets glossaries: - CSV (`.csv`): Multi-column CSV file defining equivalent glossary terms in multiple languages. The format is defined for Google Translation Toolkit and documented in [Use a glossary](https://support.google.com/translatortoolkit/answer/6306379?hl=en).{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language go %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="gcssource_go">
<a href="#gcssource_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Gcs<wbr>Source</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#gcssourceresponse">Gcs<wbr>Source<wbr>Response</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Required. Google Cloud Storage location of glossary data. File format is determined based on the filename extension. API returns [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT] for unsupported URI-s and file formats. Wildcards are not allowed. This must be a single file in one of the following formats: For unidirectional glossaries: - TSV/CSV (`.tsv`/`.csv`): 2 column file, tab- or comma-separated. The first column is source text. The second column is target text. The file must not contain headers. That is, the first row is data, not column names. - TMX (`.tmx`): TMX file with parallel data defining source/target term pairs. For equivalent term sets glossaries: - CSV (`.csv`): Multi-column CSV file defining equivalent glossary terms in multiple languages. The format is defined for Google Translation Toolkit and documented in [Use a glossary](https://support.google.com/translatortoolkit/answer/6306379?hl=en).{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language nodejs %}}

            title="Required">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#gcssourceresponse">Gcs<wbr>Source<wbr>Response</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Required. Google Cloud Storage location of glossary data. File format is determined based on the filename extension. API returns [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT] for unsupported URI-s and file formats. Wildcards are not allowed. This must be a single file in one of the following formats: For unidirectional glossaries: - TSV/CSV (`.tsv`/`.csv`): 2 column file, tab- or comma-separated. The first column is source text. The second column is target text. The file must not contain headers. That is, the first row is data, not column names. - TMX (`.tmx`): TMX file with parallel data defining source/target term pairs. For equivalent term sets glossaries: - CSV (`.csv`): Multi-column CSV file defining equivalent glossary terms in multiple languages. The format is defined for Google Translation Toolkit and documented in [Use a glossary](https://support.google.com/translatortoolkit/answer/6306379?hl=en).{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>

For equivalent term sets glossaries: - CSV (`.csv`): Multi-column CSV file defining equivalent glossary terms in multiple languages. <h4 id="languagecodepairresponse">Language<wbr>Code<wbr>Pair<wbr>Response</h4>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Required. The BCP-47 language code of the input text, for example, "en-US". Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.{{% /md %}}</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="targetlanguagecode_csharp">
<a href="#targetlanguagecode_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Target<wbr>Language<wbr>Code</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Required. The BCP-47 language code for translation output, for example, "zh-CN". Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>

<h4 id="languagecodessetresponse">Language<wbr>Codes<wbr>Set<wbr>Response</h4>



{{% choosable language csharp %}}
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="languagecodes_csharp">
<a href="#languagecodes_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Language<wbr>Codes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The BCP-47 language code(s) for terms defined in the glossary. All entries are unique. The list contains at least two entries. Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
{{% /choosable %}}

{{% choosable language go %}}

            title="Required">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">[]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}The BCP-47 language code(s) for terms defined in the glossary. All entries are unique. The list contains at least two entries. Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.{{% /md %}}</dd></dl>
